response.reasoning: I can see we're on what appears to be a canvas/project page in Figr. The interface shows a chat-like interface on the left with options to 'Share screen & explain' and 'Attach a file & start ideating'. There's also a text input area at the bottom asking to 'Describe what you are looking to solve in your product...' Along with zoom controls (200%) and a Share button in the top right. Since this appears to be a core product interface, let's extract the visible information about the product features before interacting with any elements.

tool_parameters.instruction: Extract information about the visible interface elements and features including: 1) The top navigation/header elements 2) The left sidebar options (Chat, Frames) 3) The main canvas area features 4) The input/interaction options at the bottom 5) Any visible tools or controls (zoom, share, etc.) 6) The project title and any other metadata visible

response.next_plan: After extracting the visible interface information, we'll interact with some of the core features like the chat input, sharing options, and canvas tools to understand the product's functionality better.
